Because I am using the logic of how bans are intended to work and how excessive bans will end up being used in higher elos.

I find it comical that it is mostly all bronze and low silvers who are saying this is going to be a good idea.

>Ban phase before first pick, then another after the second pair of players pick their champions.

Instead of this, why don't we just give all 10 players two bans instead of one? There's currently 141 Champions in this game (Pyke {{champion:555}} being Champion 141) & a fairly good amount of champions that are just unfun to play against.

The fact that 10 bans are not enough shows that there is a massive champion unbalance rigth now. 

You can't ban a champion that counters you, because then the enemy can pick a champion that does not counter you but is broke as balls and simply Rolls over all your team. 

Even if people ban 10 broken champions, you would find at least two or three absurdly overpowered champions in that game.

What about this.

Each player will be able to select secondary champion to ban. Such champion gets added into pool of additional bans. This pool will be shared by both teams.

When both teams select same champion for their primary ban, one random champion from the secondary ban pool will be selected instead.

This would allow to get more bans than we have now without making it riddiculous which 20 bans are.

Ideally we would like to get snake draft, but there are probably reasons why this is only for lcs.
